title: The one carry-on bag pilots swear by - Business Insider
text:
The INSIDER Summary: • Pilots love Brightline bags. • More bag system than bag, they consist of interchangeable sections that can be zipped or clipped together in a dizzying number of configurations. 
Finding the perfect carry-on bag is a bit of an oxymoron: what you need to pack can vary wildly, depending on your destination and the length of your trip. 
But according to TravelPulse , there is one suitcase that even pilots can’t get enough of. 
Technically a bag system rather than a single suitcase, BrightLine Bags (to buy: amazon.com , from $130) are interchangeable sections that can be zipped or clipped together in a dizzying number of configurations. 
Chris Cooke, a pilot with a major domestic carrier, told Travel + Leisure he has in fact seen pilots toting BrightLine Bags. “Most pilots carry computer bags or some type of over-the-shoulder, backpack-type bag,” Cooke added. 
Fortunately, aviation experts (and frequent flyers of all stripes) can alter just about every aspect of the bag. There’s even a panel with backpack straps, for example, or a clip-on handle. Every space, pouch, and pocket has a distinct function: a place to keep all of your carry-on essentials , including business cards and a camera. 
If you’re wondering why you haven’t heard of BrightLine Bags yet, it’s likely because they’re designed with aviation experts in mind (a convenient space for your pre-flight check list, a pocket for storing fuel testers, a zippered compartment for your headset). And to be sure, these bags prioritize function over design. They’re hardly the sleek, retro-inspired Rimowa Salsa Air . 
As the president of BrightLine Bags told TravelPulse , the bags are purposefully marketed toward “the field professional,” like pilots and cops. Want to travel like a pro? It’s not as complicated as it sounds. BrightLine can get you started with pre-configured setups like the B7 Flight , or a slimmer arrangement called the B2 Compute . The B7 Flight, for instance, comes equipped with rear and front pockets, two center sections, and two side pockets. Read the original article on Travel + Leisure . Copyright 2017.
